intro: Pyrus nivalis var. slavonica, commonly known as the Slavonic white pear, is a variant of the white pear native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Europe. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters, featuring smooth, grey bark and alternate, ovate leaves with a serrated margin. The plant produces small, white flowers in early spring, which are followed by round, yellowish-green fruits that ripen in late summer. It is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
